definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: He bore away to the left, stopping now and again to eat muskeg berries.
sentences.chinese: 他取道向左，時而停下來喫些苔蘚漿果。

sentences.english: Goods are shipped thousands of miles out of the way simply to avoid hostile territory.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避開敵對國家，商品的運輸往往要取道數千英里。

sentences.english: So he departed by another way, and returned not by the way that he came into Bethel.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他另取道而行，沒有從他來貝特耳的路上回去。

sentences.english: I usually take the M6 when I go to Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 我到蘇格蘭去通常都取道。

sentences.english: She picked her way through the alfalfa and took the road that ran through the village.
sentences.chinese: 她取道穿過苜蓿，跑過村子。

sentences.english: He flew to New York via Shanghai.
He turned from the morning noises of the quayside and walked through Lime street.
sentences.chinese: 他避開了早晨碼頭上的噪音，取道利穆街。

sentences.english: So he departed by another road and did not go back the way he had come to Bethel.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他另取道而行，沒有從他來貝特耳的路上回去。

sentences.english: ATS48(JN4092) was seen here at Queensway heading for Chuk Yuen Estate in Kowloon.
sentences.chinese: 這天ATS48正取道金鐘道，向九龍竹園村進發。

sentences.english: He came to Europe via Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 他取道土耳其來到歐洲。

definition: land route/to go by surface transport
to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
to make a detour/to go by way of
to return/to go back/to come back
to run away/to go into exile
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
